Question: 1. What happens to cases and proceedings pending before the Divisional Commissioner on the day immediately preceding the coming into force of the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007?
Answer: All cases and proceedings pending before the Divisional Commissioner on the day immediately preceding the coming into force of the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007, shall be transferred to the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal and disposed of by the Tribunal under the provisions of the said Code or the relevant Act.

Question: 2. How are cases and proceedings transferred and disposed of after the revival of the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal by the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007?
Answer: After the revival of the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal by the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007, all cases and proceedings pending before the Divisional Commissioner on the day immediately preceding the coming into force of the said Act shall be transferred to the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal. These cases and proceedings will then be disposed of by the Tribunal under the provisions of the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code or the relevant Act.

Question: 3. What is the significance of the Schedule appended to the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007?
Answer: The Schedule appended to the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007 lists various Revenue Acts, Tenancy Acts, Ceiling on Holdings Act, Tenure Abolition Acts, and Other Acts. The significance of this Schedule is that it specifies the enactments where references to the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal are to be made instead of the Divisional Commissioner, as per the provisions of the Act. This helps in the transfer of pending cases and proceedings to the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal for disposal under the relevant provisions of the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code or other relevant Acts.

Question: 9. How are references to the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal handled in various enactments, rules, regulations, bye-laws, notifications, orders, or instruments after the revival of the Tribunal?
Answer: After the revival of the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal, references to the Tribunal in any enactments specified in the Schedule appended to the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007, as well as any such references in rules, regulations, bye-laws, notifications, orders issued under any of these enactments, or in any instrument that was to be construed as the Divisional Commissioner by virtue of the provisions of section 14 of the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Amendment) Act, 2002, shall now be referred to as the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal.

Question: 10. What is the Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007's provision regarding the construction of references to the Divisional Commissioner?
Answer: The Maharashtra Land Revenue Code (Second Amendment) Act, 2007 states that any reference to the Divisional Commissioner in any enactment specified in the Schedule appended to the Act, as well as any such reference in rules, regulations, bye-laws, notifications, orders issued under any of these enactments, or in any instrument, shall now be referred to as the Maharashtra Revenue Tribunal.
